The parameters include turbidity, pH, dissolved oxygen (DO), salinity, and temperature. Sampling occurs at designated locations within various water bodies such as the Bay, D-Pool (fishing pond), C-Pool, B-Pool, and A-Pool. The dataset is maintained to ensure accuracy and reliability in monitoring water quality over time.

field.name: Date
field.description: Indicates the date when the data entry was recorded.

field.name: Salinity (ppt)
field.description: Represents the salinity level of the water in parts per thousand (ppt).

field.name: DissolvedOxygen (mg/L)
field.description: Indicates the concentration of dissolved oxygen in the water, measured in milligrams per liter (mg/L).

field.name: pH
field.description: Represents the acidity or alkalinity level of the water.

field.name: SecchiDepth (m)
field.description: Measures the depth at which a Secchi disk becomes invisible in the water, indicating water clarity, in meters (m).

field.name: WaterDepth (m)
field.description: Measures the depth of the water column, typically in meters (m).

field.name: WaterTemp (C)
field.description: Measures the temperature of the water in degrees Celsius (°C).

field.name: AirTemp (C)
field.description: Measures the temperature of the air in degrees Celsius (°C).

keywords: subject > earth and nature > earth science
name: Water Quality Data 🌊
description:
# Description

The dataset comprises detailed records of water quality parameters collected at the Refuge by volunteers once every two weeks. These measurements include turbidity, pH, dissolved oxygen (DO), salinity, and temperature. Sampling is conducted at designated locations within various water bodies such as the Bay, D-Pool (fishing pond), C-Pool, B-Pool, and A-Pool.

# Contents

1. **Date**: Indicates the date when the water quality data was recorded.
2. **Salinity**: Denotes the concentration of salts in the water.
3. **Dissolved Oxygen**: Indicates the amount of oxygen dissolved in the water, crucial for aquatic life.
4. **pH**: Represents the acidity or alkalinity level of the water.
5. **Secchi Depth (m):** Measures the depth at which a Secchi disk disappears from view, providing insight into water transparency.
6. **Water Depth**: Indicates the depth of the water column at the sampling location.
7. **Water Temperature**: Provides the thermal condition of the water.
9. **Air Temperature**: Represents the ambient air temperature during sampling.

# Data Collection

The water quality data collection process is managed by volunteers under the supervision of the Refuge authority. Sampling occurs once every two weeks at designated locations across the various water bodies within the Refuge. The dataset is meticulously maintained, ensuring accuracy and reliability in monitoring the water quality over time.

# Purpose

The dataset serves to monitor and analyze the water quality parameters at the Refuge, providing valuable insights into environmental health and aquatic habitat conditions.

# Applications and Utility

The dataset on water quality has numerous applications and utilities across various domains:
1. **Economic Analysis**: Assess economic viability of projects and investments related to water-based activities such as aquaculture and tourism by considering water quality conditions.
2. **Predictive Modelling**: Employ time series analysis on historical water quality data to develop predictive models, forecasting future trends and fluctuations in key parameters for proactive planning and resource allocation.
3. **Emergency Response Planning**: Utilize real-time monitoring data and predictive models to plan for and respond to environmental emergencies such as contamination incidents or natural disasters affecting water bodies.

**File Format**: Expect the dataset to be structured in a tabular format, most likely as a CSV (Comma-Separated Values) file or a similar structured format.

**Usage Notes**: Data interpretation should consider variations in sampling frequency, methodology, and environmental conditions. Exercise caution when analyzing trends or making comparisons over time, as changes in sampling techniques may affect data consistency. Volunteer-collected data may have limitations, including variations in sampling techniques and equipment calibration.

**Dataset Link**: [Water Quality Data](https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/water-quality-data-41c5e)

By providing access to this dataset, users can gain valuable insights into water quality at the Refuge, aiding informed decision-making and environmental management.
